titleStmt.title: Letter from Bower Aly to John G. Neihardt, October 5, 1964
titleStmt.author: Aly, Bower, 1903-1977

publicationStmt.authority: The Papers of John G. Neihardt

distributor.name: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

bibl.author: Aly, Bower, 1903-1977
bibl.title: Letter from Bower Aly to John G. Neihardt

revisionDesc.change: Weakly, Laura K. Proofreading and encoding
Jenkins, Leroy Transcription and Initial Encoding

div1.p: I have just received information from the AAUP office in Washington that the annual meeting will be held on April 9 & 10, at the Mayflower Hotel, in Washington.... for 1965, that it. If the Oregon chapter of Washington to represent the Chapter, I will be glad to do it. If you want me to do so, let me know in time to make my schedule and maybe stir up a little interest in one or two little fratious matters.
All goes well here, except that I am frightfully overworked. I have to teach three or four hours a week, and that so exhausts me that I am unable to serve on any committees, or take on chores.

Actually, I am soaking up the history of public speaking in the United States like a sponge and having a wonderful time. I have a study-office near the American history stacks in the marvelous new Olin library, where I spend most of my time. Wish me luck.
